header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: True self-direction, the secret of genius, involves consciously becoming aware of the principles that attract fulfilling experiences by developing the capacity to handle one's mental and emotional nature, ultimately leading to the realization of one's unique divine potential and the experience of Unity of Life.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 6: Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: This lesson explores the art of self-direction as the key to genius, stemming from the previous lesson's emphasis on defining one's wants. It highlights how indecision leads to cyclical mistakes and bitterness. The text asserts that self-contempt attracts hateful experiences and that occult students often fail because they overlook the importance of conscious self-direction. It introduces the concept of being a perfected instrument for the Divine, contrasting this with using spiritual ideas as an escape mechanism. The lesson emphasizes that true evolution requires working with one's mental and emotional nature and feeling the 'Unity of Life,' rather than denying problems. It stresses that transmutation occurs by introducing opposites and that desire, when properly understood, is a divine gift crucial for evolutionary progress. The text also touches on the unique genius of each individual, the importance of self-love, and the potential of Qabalah and Tarot techniques for personal transformation. It explains that occult training is an accelerated evolutionary process, demanding a yearning to serve Life and the joy found in even the lowliest tasks. The ultimate goal is to integrate the mental and emotional faculties, particularly focusing on the power residing in the emotional nature and the concept of 'Divine Will' working through the individual.

key_concepts.definition: The secret of genius, involving conscious awareness of principles to attract fulfilling experiences by mastering one's mental and emotional nature and deciding what one wants to be and do.
Abilities developed through esoteric extension and self-direction, particularly through the use of Tarot and Qabalah, leading to a more profound understanding and experience of life.

The recognition that all beings are interconnected on a subconscious level, where thoughts and feelings affect everyone else. It is characterized by compassion and the absence of hatred towards oneself or others.
The process of overcoming negative mental and emotional patterns by introducing their opposites, rather than through denial. This is key to transforming oneself and attracting desired experiences.
The unique, divine essence within each individual. The text encourages embracing this unique self rather than wishing to be like others.
The ideal state for a spiritual aspirant, where one becomes a pure channel through which the Divine (Higher Genius, Higher Self, God) can function and act unimpeded by personality imperfections.
A divine gift and a driving force for evolution, not to be eliminated but understood and harnessed for growth toward fulfilling one's higher purpose, such as Cosmic Consciousness.
An accelerated, hothouse-like process designed to speed up evolutionary growth, narrowing the time period required for development, often through systems like Tarot and Qabalah.

practical_system.description: The system presented is one of conscious self-direction and emotional/mental transmutation, framed within a process of accelerated spiritual evolution. It emphasizes understanding and utilizing one's desires, cultivating self-love, and aligning with the Divine Will. The core mechanic involves identifying and replacing negative or immature patterns ('immature elements within yourself') with their opposites, thereby transforming the individual into a more perfect instrument for the Divine. This process is facilitated by techniques such as meditation, self-analysis, and potentially the study and application of Tarot and Qabalah. The ultimate goal is to achieve a state of 'Cosmic Consciousness' or 'perfected humanity' by developing one's unique genius and radiating 'creative thoughts, thoughts of love, fulfilled thoughts.'

relevant_quotes.text: Those who fail to decide, continue to meander, victims of past subconscious patterns, reliving the same patterns over and over, making the same mistakes, weeping the same tears.
Those who have the capacity to tune into what we are radiating, respond and play back to us the things that we feel; self-hatred, frustration, betrayal.
If we feel this way about ourselves, as surely as night follows day, we cannot help reacting in the same way to those around us.

Remember that if a true spiritual aspirant holds the idea that he is not seeking personal happiness, that all he wants is to find God, he is using spiritual ideas and principles as an escape mechanism, because he has no faith in his powers.

This is our role, and if we are to be perfected instruments in and through which the Higher Genius, the Higher Self, the Higher Soul, God, can live and act, we must stop feeling and creating and emanating endlessly those elements in our personality that make the personality, the instrument, imperfect.

The factor which determines whether or not one makes the grade in this division which is taking place now is one's ability to work with his own mental and emotional nature and the ability to feel the Unity of Life.
Within this we all live and move and have our being, so that there is nothing which anyone thinks or feels that does not affect everyone else!
You cannot transmute through denial. You transmute something by putting its opposite in its place!
This is why we want you to decide what you want, because everything is a matter of want! If you do not desire illumination enough, you will not work for it.
Desire is the gift of God. The yearning that overflows the heart is a promise.
This is the way in which our genius is developed, our self-conscious genius.

Make your transference to God! At whatever evolutionary level you are, blame God for the age that you are, for that is why you make mistakes. Instead of hating yourself, try to learn from the immature elements within yourself. This is the way we grow more rapidly.
This is your unique livingness and your genius. Hence, you should not want to be like any other person.
If you are insecure, your nature will embrace either possessiveness or jealousy, because they stem from insecurity.
This is why we stress so much the importance of loving yourself, loving yourself in the way that God loves you.

Personal power and personal will are nothing. But when we say, 'The Divine Will works in and through me,' and mean it, we open ourselves to the influx of all of the riches of the universe, the Cosmic Flow, to give us the fire, the force, the abilities, and the capacity to transmute that in our nature that requires it.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in self-mastery, spiritual development, and the practical application of occult principles for personal evolution. It bridges the gap between abstract philosophy and actionable techniques, emphasizing self-awareness and conscious choice as foundational to developing latent potentials. The integration of Tarot and Qabalah as tools for self-analysis and transmutation aligns with common practices in modern occultism.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of individuals actively engaged in esoteric or metaphysical studies, aspiring occultists, spiritual seekers, and students of systems like Qabalah and Tarot. It is particularly suited for those who have moved beyond basic theoretical understanding and are seeking deeper insights into practical self-transformation and the development of 'supersensory powers' or inner genius.
